page.title: 17INDUSTRY 3 - COLYTON Tannery
page.content: The first pit is weak but the hides are put through 14 pits in all, getting stronger each time. The process takes about 9 months, depending on the strength of the the liquor and the temperature. After the pits, the hides are put into drums and spun in stronger liquor for finishing. They are then dried carefully before going through a variety of processes such as scrubbing, oil rubbing, rolling and shaving for different uses. The hides are left overnight in a heated vat containing mutton tallow, cod oil and shumac to give an attractive colour. Further layers of colour are built up by hand and then the hide is greased to preserve it. About 25% of output is used for harness leather and 60% for medical use which, by law, can only be oak tanned leather.
